description: Album metadata database - maps album names/paths to metadata. This file is read by the Dropbox sync script to enrich album information.

albums.description: Soundtrack to the surreal film of the same name, featuring orchestral arrangements and rock compositions. A satirical rock opera about life on the road.
Live album recorded during the 1974 tour, featuring performances from the Roxy Theatre and other venues. Showcases Zappa's virtuosic guitar work and complex arrangements.
The second Mothers of Invention album, featuring satirical social commentary and experimental compositions. Includes the suite 'America Drinks and Goes Home'.
Posthumous live album recorded at the Royal Festival Hall in London, 1968. Features early Mothers of Invention performances with orchestral backing.
One of Zappa's most commercially successful albums, featuring jazz fusion, progressive rock, and comedic elements. Includes the classic 'Don't Eat The Yellow Snow' suite.
Live album and soundtrack to the concert film of the same name, recorded in New York in 1977. Features performances with Terry Bozzio and Adrian Belew.
Collaborative live album with Captain Beefheart, recorded at the Armadillo World Headquarters in Austin, Texas. Features a mix of Zappa and Beefheart compositions.
albums.subtitle: 1975 Live Album with Captain Beefheart

albums.description: Live album from the 1988 tour, featuring political satire and social commentary. Includes covers of 'Stairway to Heaven' and 'Purple Haze'.
Posthumous live album recorded in Buffalo, New York in 1974. Features performances from the Roxy & Elsewhere era band with George Duke and Ruth Underwood.
Compilation album featuring studio and live recordings from the late 1960s. Mixes experimental compositions with doo-wop and rock elements.
Posthumous live album recorded at Carnegie Hall in New York City in 1971. Features performances with The Mothers of Invention and orchestral arrangements.
Posthumous live album recorded in Chicago in 1978. Features performances from the late 1970s touring band with complex instrumental arrangements.
Zappa's first solo album after disbanding the original Mothers. Features a mix of studio and live tracks with jazz fusion and rock elements.
Posthumous release featuring Synclavier compositions and spoken word pieces. A continuation of Zappa's experimental electronic music work.
Posthumous release featuring live performances and studio recordings. The title references Zappa's advocacy for free speech and artistic freedom.
albums.subtitle: 2010 Vault Release

albums.description: A doo-wop concept album parodying 1950s rock and roll. Features The Mothers performing in the style of early rock groups with Zappa's characteristic humor.
Posthumous release featuring Synclavier compositions from Zappa's final years. Electronic music showcasing his compositional techniques and rhythmic complexity.
Live album from the 1984 tour, featuring performances with the final touring band. Includes both comedic and serious compositions showcasing Zappa's musical range.
Posthumous release featuring live recordings from the 1975 tour with the Grand Wazoo band. Focuses on jazz fusion and instrumental compositions.

albums.match: Feeding the Monkies at Ma Maison
albums.description: Posthumous compilation album featuring previously unreleased material from Zappa's vault. Includes studio and live recordings.
albums.subtitle: 2011 Vault Release

albums.description: Live album recorded at the Fillmore East in New York City. Features performances with The Mothers of Invention and guest appearances.
albums.subtitle: 1971 Live Album

albums.description: Posthumous compilation featuring previously unreleased live and studio recordings from various periods. Curated selections from Zappa's vault.
Album featuring Zappa's Synclavier arrangements of compositions by 18th-century Italian composer Francesco Zappa (no relation). Classical music with electronic instrumentation.
Posthumous compilation featuring political songs and commentary from throughout Zappa's career. Includes material related to his 1992 presidential campaign.
The debut album by The Mothers of Invention, a double album that helped define progressive rock. Features social satire, experimental music, and early psychedelic rock.
Posthumous release featuring unreleased studio sessions from 1970, recorded between Hot Rats and Chunga's Revenge. Focuses on jazz fusion and instrumental jams.
Posthumous live album recorded in Australia in 1976. Features performances from the mid-1970s touring band with complex arrangements and extended improvisations.
Posthumous compilation focusing on Zappa's doo-wop and vocal group arrangements. Features material from Cruising with Ruben & The Jets and related recordings.
Double album featuring Zappa's guitar solos extracted from live performances spanning 1979-1984. Showcases his virtuosic and improvisational guitar work.
Posthumous live album featuring Halloween performances from New York in 1978. Zappa traditionally performed special Halloween shows with extended sets.
Posthumous live album recorded at the Hammersmith Odeon in London in 1978. Features performances from the late 1970s touring band.
Posthumous compilation featuring songs that were censored or controversial throughout Zappa's career. Includes material addressing free speech and censorship.
Groundbreaking jazz fusion album featuring instrumental compositions and guest appearances. Considered one of Zappa's most influential works, blending rock with jazz improvisation.
Posthumous live album featuring performances from the Petit Wazoo tour in 1972. Focuses on jazz fusion and instrumental compositions with large ensemble arrangements.
Grammy Award-winning album featuring entirely Synclavier-composed music. Complex electronic compositions showcasing Zappa's advanced compositional techniques.
Posthumous release from the Joe's Garage project, featuring outtakes and alternate versions. Part of the series of Joe's Garage-related vault releases.
Posthumous release featuring early versions and outtakes from the Joe's Garage project. Includes studio sessions and alternate takes from 1978-1979.
Posthumous release featuring outtakes and alternate versions from the Joe's Garage project. Includes material that didn't make it onto the final album.

albums.match: Joe's Garage Acts I, II & III
albums.description: A rock opera telling the story of Joe, a musician in a dystopian future where music is illegal. Released as three separate albums, later combined. Features complex compositions and social commentary.
Posthumous release from the Joe's Garage project, featuring additional outtakes and studio sessions. Part of the ongoing series of Joe's Garage vault releases.
Posthumous holiday-themed release from the Joe's Garage project, featuring Christmas-related outtakes and studio sessions. Part of the Joe's Garage vault series.
Live album recorded in Los Angeles featuring performances with Flo & Eddie. Includes extended comedic routines and rock compositions.
Posthumous release of a quadruple album originally intended for release in 1977 but blocked by Warner Bros. Features a mix of studio and live material from 1976-1977.
Posthumous live album featuring jazz fusion performances from 1976. Includes extended instrumental compositions and improvisations.
Experimental album featuring orchestral arrangements, spoken word, and musique concrète. Originally released as a solo album, later credited to The Mothers of Invention.
Live album from the 1988 tour, focusing on jazz fusion and instrumental compositions. Features complex arrangements and extended solos.
Album addressing censorship and the Parents Music Resource Center (PMRC). Features both Synclavier compositions and live tracks with political commentary.
Compilation album featuring selections from the first five Mothers of Invention albums. Curated by Zappa to showcase the band's early work.
Posthumous compilation featuring rare and previously unreleased material from various periods. Includes studio outtakes, live recordings, and experimental pieces.
Posthumous compilation featuring one-off performances and rare live recordings from various tours. Includes material from different eras and lineups.
Studio album featuring complex compositions and virtuosic performances. Includes the epic 'Inca Roads' and showcases the mid-1970s touring band.
Live album featuring orchestral compositions performed by the Abnuceals Emuukha Electric Symphony Orchestra in 1975. Classical arrangements of Zappa's music.
Commercial breakthrough album featuring accessible yet complex compositions. Includes 'Montana', 'Dirty Love', and other popular tracks with sophisticated arrangements.
Posthumous live album featuring performances with Flo & Eddie from the early 1970s. Includes extended comedic routines and rock compositions.

albums.match: Plays The Music Of Frank Zappa
albums.description: Album featuring the Ensemble Modern performing Zappa's orchestral compositions. Classical interpretations of Zappa's complex works, recorded with his supervision.
Posthumous live album from the Road Tapes series, featuring performances from a specific venue. Part of an ongoing series documenting Zappa's live shows.
Posthumous live album from the Road Tapes series, featuring performances from another venue. Continues the documentation of Zappa's extensive touring.
Live double album primarily recorded at the Roxy Theatre in Los Angeles. Features the mid-1970s band with George Duke, Ruth Underwood, and Napoleon Murphy Brock.
Posthumous live album featuring additional performances from the Roxy Theatre era. Complements the original Roxy & Elsewhere album with more material from those shows.
Soundtrack to the concert film documenting the Roxy Theatre performances. Features the complete audio from the film with the mid-1970s touring band.
Double album featuring a mix of studio and live tracks. Includes popular songs like 'Dancin' Fool' and 'Bobby Brown', showcasing Zappa's satirical songwriting and complex arrangements.

albums.match: Ship Arriving Too Late To Save A Drowning Witch
albums.description: Studio album featuring complex compositions and the early 1980s touring band. Includes 'Valley Girl' featuring Moon Unit Zappa, which became a surprise hit.
Triple album featuring entirely instrumental guitar solos extracted from live performances. Showcases Zappa's virtuosic improvisational guitar work without vocals or lyrics.
Studio album featuring instrumental compositions originally intended for the Lather project. Includes complex arrangements and showcases Zappa's compositional skills.
Studio album featuring material originally intended for the Lather project. Includes complex instrumental compositions and orchestral arrangements.

albums.match: The Best Band You Never Heard In Your Life
albums.description: Live double album from the 1988 tour, featuring covers, original compositions, and complex arrangements. Showcases the final touring band's versatility.
Posthumous release featuring outtakes and alternate versions from the Apostrophe (') album sessions. Includes material from the early 1970s recording sessions.
Jazz fusion album featuring large ensemble arrangements. Recorded while Zappa was recovering from an injury, showcasing complex instrumental compositions with big band instrumentation.
Posthumous compilation featuring rare and previously unreleased material from 1961-1978. Includes early recordings, outtakes, and live performances from various periods.
Posthumous release featuring outtakes and alternate versions from the Lumpy Gravy album sessions. Includes material from the original 1967 recording sessions.
Studio album featuring a mix of new compositions and reworked older material. Includes complex arrangements and showcases the early 1980s touring band.
Posthumous release featuring outtakes and alternate versions from the We're Only In It For The Money album sessions. Includes material from the original 1967-1968 recording sessions.
Album featuring orchestral compositions performed by the Ensemble InterContemporain conducted by Pierre Boulez, alongside Synclavier pieces. Classical interpretations of Zappa's works.
Posthumous box set featuring complete performances from the Roxy Theatre in December 1973. Comprehensive documentation of those legendary shows with the mid-1970s band.
Final album released during Zappa's lifetime, featuring the Ensemble Modern performing his orchestral compositions. Classical interpretations recorded in Europe with Zappa's supervision.
Double album featuring a mix of studio and live tracks. Includes covers, original compositions, and addresses themes of censorship and social commentary.
Triple album rock opera addressing themes of AIDS, censorship, and social issues. Features reworked versions of older songs with new lyrics and arrangements.
Live album from the 1980 tour, featuring performances with the early 1980s touring band. Includes both new material and reworked older songs.
Posthumous release featuring Synclavier compositions from Zappa's final years. Electronic music showcasing advanced rhythmic and harmonic concepts.
Double album soundtrack to an unfinished film project. Features a mix of studio recordings, live performances, and spoken word, showcasing the band's experimental approach.
Posthumous compilation featuring songs addressing American culture, politics, and social issues. Curated selections showcasing Zappa's satirical commentary on society.
Jazz fusion album featuring large ensemble arrangements. Companion piece to The Grand Wazoo, showcasing complex instrumental compositions with big band instrumentation.
Posthumous live album recorded in Boston in 1972 with the Grand Wazoo big band. Features large ensemble jazz fusion performances with complex arrangements.
Compilation album featuring live and studio recordings from the late 1960s. Mixes experimental compositions, free jazz, and rock elements from the original Mothers era.

albums.match: We're Only In It For The Money
albums.description: Satirical concept album parodying The Beatles' Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band. Features social commentary, experimental music, and collage-style production techniques.
Double album featuring satirical songs addressing various social issues and cultural phenomena. Includes complex arrangements and showcases the early 1980s touring band.

albums.match: You Can't Do That On Stage Anymore, Vol. 1
albums.description: First volume in a six-part live series featuring performances from various tours. Showcases different eras and lineups of Zappa's bands across his career.

albums.match: You Can't Do That On Stage Anymore, Vol. 2
albums.description: Second volume in the live series, featuring performances from the Helsinki concerts in 1974. Showcases the mid-1970s touring band with extended improvisations.

albums.match: You Can't Do That On Stage Anymore, Vol. 3
albums.description: Third volume in the live series, featuring performances from various tours. Includes material showcasing different eras and musical styles from Zappa's career.

albums.match: You Can't Do That On Stage Anymore, Vol. 4
albums.description: Fourth volume in the live series, featuring performances from the 1984 tour. Showcases the final touring band with complex arrangements and extended solos.

albums.match: You Can't Do That On Stage Anymore, Vol. 5
albums.description: Fifth volume in the live series, featuring performances from various tours. Includes material showcasing the evolution of Zappa's compositions across different eras.

albums.match: You Can't Do That On Stage Anymore, Vol. 6
albums.description: Final volume in the live series, featuring performances from various tours. Completes the comprehensive documentation of Zappa's live performances across his career.

Posthumous live album documenting Frank Zappa's only performances in Yugoslavia, recorded in Zagreb and Ljubljana in November 1975. Features the rare final lineup of The Mothers with complex arrangements and extended improvisations from the mid-1970s touring band.
Posthumous live album recorded in Erie, Pennsylvania in 1974. Features performances from the Roxy & Elsewhere era band with extended compositions and improvisations.
Live double album recorded at the Palladium in New York City in 1976. Features performances with the late 1970s touring band, including complex instrumental compositions.
Posthumous compilation featuring previously unreleased material from Zappa's vault. Curated selections showcasing various aspects of his musical output.
Posthumous compilation continuing the series, featuring more previously unreleased material from Zappa's vault. Includes live and studio recordings from various periods.
Posthumous compilation featuring popular and accessible tracks from throughout Zappa's career. Curated selection designed as an introduction to his music.
Studio album featuring a mix of complex instrumental compositions and vocal tracks. Includes the epic 'Black Napkins' and showcases Zappa's guitar work and compositional skills.
Posthumous compilation album featuring selections from throughout Zappa's career. The title stands for 'Any Way The Wind Blows' and includes material from various eras and musical styles.
Posthumous live album recorded in Philadelphia in 1976. Features performances from the late 1970s touring band with complex arrangements and extended improvisations.
Posthumous release featuring Synclavier compositions from Zappa's vault. Electronic music showcasing advanced compositional techniques and rhythmic complexity.
Compilation album featuring live performances and studio recordings. Includes material from various periods, showcasing Zappa's diverse musical output and production techniques.
First volume in The Old Masters box set series, featuring remastered versions of early Mothers of Invention albums. Includes Freak Out!, Absolutely Free, and We're Only In It For The Money.
Second volume in The Old Masters box set series, featuring remastered versions of albums from the late 1960s and early 1970s. Includes Cruising with Ruben & The Jets, Uncle Meat, and Hot Rats.
Third volume in The Old Masters box set series, featuring remastered versions of albums from the 1970s. Includes material from various periods showcasing Zappa's evolving musical style.

_instructions.match: Album folder name (case-insensitive, partial matches supported)
_instructions.coverArt: Cover art file path relative to album folder (e.g., 'Cover/1 Front.jpg'), or null to use auto-detection
_instructions.subtitle: Optional subtitle
